com.philips.platform.core.dbinterfaces

Interface DBDeletingInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    VerticalDBDeletingInterfaceImpl

    public interface DBDeletingInterface
    Data Base Deleting Interfaces for implementing Delete Operations on DB

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deleteAll(DBRequestListener dbRequestListener)
      Delete All the Entries from All the tables
      void deleteAllExpiredInsights(DBRequestListener<Insight> dbRequestListener)

      Batch Operation for deleting more than one moment When Propositions requests for delete, first the moments are marked as inActive One's the Data gets synced with the cloud, that particular moment is deleted from Data-Base

    • Method Detail

      • deleteAll

        void deleteAll(DBRequestListener dbRequestListener)
        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Delete All the Entries from All the tables
        Parameters:
        dbRequestListener - Callback for notifying the deleteAll result
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - throws exception if DataBase operation fails

      • markAsInActive

        void markAsInActive(Moment moment,
                    DBRequestListener<Moment> dbRequestListener)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Mark the Moment as InActive. While the propositions request for delete moment, The Moment is first marked as inactive. One's the success response is received from server, the Moment Entry is deleted from Data-Base
        Parameters:
        moment - The Moment to be deleted
        dbRequestListener - Callback for notifying the delete result
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - throws exception if DataBase operation fails

        dbRequestListener - Callback for notifying the delete result

        java.sql.SQLException - throws exception if DataBase operation fails

      • deleteMoments

        boolean deleteMoments(java.util.List<Moment> moments,
                      DBRequestListener<Moment> dbRequestListener)
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Delete the list of moments from the DataBase
        Parameters:
        moments - List of moments to be deleted
        dbRequestListener - Callback for notifying the deleteAllMoments
        Returns:
        returns weather the DB operation was success (true) or failure (false)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - throws exception if DataBase operation fails

      • markMomentsAsInActive

        void markMomentsAsInActive(java.util.List<Moment> moment,
                           DBRequestListener<Moment> dbRequestListener)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Batch Operation for deleting more than one moment When Propositions requests for delete, first the moments are marked as inActive One's the Data gets synced with the cloud, that particular moment is deleted from Data-Base
        Parameters:
        moment - List of moments to be deleted
        dbRequestListener - Callback for notifying the "deleteBatch" result
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - throws exception if DataBase operation fails

      • markInsightsAsInActive

        boolean markInsightsAsInActive(java.util.List<Insight> insights,
                               DBRequestListener<Insight> dbRequestListener)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Batch Operation for deleting the Insights When Propositions requests for delete, first the insights are marked as inActive One's the Data gets synced with the cloud, that particular insight is deleted from Data-Base
        Parameters:
        insights - The List of Insights to be deleted
        dbRequestListener - Callback for notifying the "deleteBatch" result
        Returns:
        returns a boolean indicating the database operation fail/success
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - throws exception if DataBase operation fails
